results.title: Ayers Rock; Brick and Tile; Incongruous
results.brief_description: A collection of three experimental films made by filmmaker, Paul Winkler. These films present fascinating combinations, juxtapositions and manipulation of moving and still images. The first film makes use of images of the Ayers Rock, Australian bushland, and patterns from aboriginal bark paintings. The second film uses images of bricks and tiles. The last film shows juxtaposition of rural and urban images. Each film has an interesting soundtrack, matching the moving images.

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Aya
results.creator_credit: Goshu Films, Denise Patience and Solrun Hoaas
results.brief_description: The story of Aya, the Japanese war bride of an Australian serviceman, spans over twenty years from the early fifties to to the mid-seventies. Hoaas’ intention was to question Australian attitudes to Asians and to express, through the character of Aya’s husband Frank, some disturbing contradictions in the Australian male psyche. In her examination of cross-cultural complexities Hoaas is reticent in projecting feelings, adopting a somewhat elliptical approach to dramatising Aya’s relationship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Goshu Films, Denise Patience and Solrun Hoaas

results.title: Axemanship
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Peter McLarin who has held world records for chopping in England, Australia and the United States, demonstrates the proper use and care of an axe. Principles of safety and efficiency are stressed.

results.title: Awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
John Cleese and Angharad Rees play two sales assistants who demonstrate how to handle awkward customers. Shows the customer in a temper, the compulsive talker and the rude, aggressive and offensive customer. John Barron, June Whitfield and George A. Cooper appear as the awkward customers. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Away from it all
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Jean Roy
results.brief_description: Terra Nova Park, Newfoundland, is the most recent example of the purpose and dimension of Canada’s national parks system - a plan which sets aside, for the enjoyment of present and future generations, scenic acres of wilderness, undisturbed except for roads, camp-sites, and other amenities. This film shows how Terra Nova was developed and how it offers a restful escape from the clamor of the city. Award: Annual Film Festival, Columbus, Ohio.

results.title: Awaiting re-construction
results.brief_description: Interpretative piece on the power of images, both visually and textually, and the loss of identity, particularly for women, in western culture today. Uses a combination of animation, live-action and voice-over.

results.title: Avoiding danger
results.creator_credit: National Association of Citizens Advice Bureau and Paul White
results.brief_description: In July 1986 Estate Agent, Suzy Lamplugh, disappeared while on a client appointment. The Suzy Lamplugh Trust was set up to encourage increased awareness among employers and staff of the potential danger from attack in the workplace. The Trust is engaged in comprehensive research in the field of personal vulnerability, and is developing courses to promote greater understanding of the ways to minimise risk. There are practical steps that everyone can take. First, AVOID potential risk by following cautionary procedures. TALK in ways that will placate rather than provoke customers or clients who are aggressive. WALK away from danger. DEFEND yourself if all other methods fail.

results.title: Avocets return
results.creator_credit: RSPB Film and Video Unit, Anthony Bomford and Anthony Clay
results.brief_description: This film shows how the Avocet has returned to Britain, as a breeding bird, after a lapse of 100 years. Filmed in Suffolk and Cornwall, it traces the natural history of the Avocet, and the success of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds in protecting rare species.
